models.name: PermitAllocation
models.doc: Used by gobblin-throttling-service to allocate permits to a client.

fields.name: permits
fields.doc: Number of permits allocated. This may be 0 if no permits are allocated, or the number of requested permits.

fields.name: expiration
fields.doc: Expiration time in Unix timestamp of the allocated permits.

fields.name: minRetryDelayMillis
fields.doc: Client should not try to acquire permits before this delay has passed.

models.name: PermitRequest
models.doc: Used to request permits from a gobblin-throttling-service.

fields.name: resource
fields.doc: Resource for which permits are needed.

fields.name: requestorIdentifier
fields.doc: Identifier of the service requesting the permits.

models.name: EmptyRecord
models.doc: An literally empty record.  Intended as a marker to indicate the absence of content where a record type is required.  If used the underlying DataMap *must* be empty, EmptyRecordValidator is provided to help enforce this.  For example,  CreateRequest extends Request<EmptyRecord> to indicate it has no response body.   Also, a ComplexKeyResource implementation that has no ParamKey should have a signature like XyzResource implements ComplexKeyResource<XyzKey, EmptyRecord, Xyz>.

schema.name: permits
schema.doc:
Restli resource for allocating permits through Rest calls. Simply calls a {@link Limiter} in the server configured
 through {@link SharedResourcesBroker}.

generated from: org.apache.gobblin.restli.throttling.LimiterServerResource

methods.doc:
Request permits from the limiter server. The returned {@link PermitAllocation} specifies the number of permits
 that the client can use.
